verses.plain: Watching for riches consumeth the flesh, and the care thereof driveth away sleep.

tokens.t: Watching for riches consumeth the flesh, and the care thereof driveth away sleep.

verses.plain: Watching care will not let a man slumber, as a sore disease breaketh sleep,

tokens.t: Watching care will not let a man slumber, as a sore disease breaketh sleep,

verses.plain: The rich hath great labour in gathering riches together; and when he resteth, he is filled with his delicates.

tokens.t: The rich hath great labour in gathering riches together; and when he resteth, he is filled with his delicates.

verses.plain: The poor laboureth in his poor estate; and when he leaveth off, he is still needy.

tokens.t: The poor laboureth in his poor estate; and when he leaveth off, he is still needy.

verses.plain: He that loveth gold shall not be justified, and he that followeth corruption shall have enough thereof.

tokens.t: He that loveth gold shall not be justified, and he that followeth corruption shall have enough thereof.

verses.plain: Gold hath been the ruin of many, and their destruction was present.

tokens.t: Gold hath been the ruin of many, and their destruction was present.

verses.plain: It is a stumblingblock unto them that sacrifice unto it, and every fool shall be taken therewith.

tokens.t: It is a stumblingblock unto them that sacrifice unto it, and every fool shall be taken therewith.

verses.plain: Blessed is the rich that is found without blemish, and hath not gone after gold.

tokens.t: Blessed is the rich that is found without blemish, and hath not gone after gold.

verses.plain: Who is he? and we will call him blessed: for wonderful things hath he done among his people.

tokens.t: Who is he? and we will call him blessed: for wonderful things hath he done among his people.

verses.plain: Who hath been tried thereby, and found perfect? then let him glory. Who might offend, and hath not offended? or done evil, and hath not done it?

tokens.t: Who hath been tried thereby, and found perfect? then let him glory. Who might offend, and hath not offended? or done evil, and hath not done it?

verses.plain: His goods shall be established, and the congregation shall declare his alms.

tokens.t: His goods shall be established, and the congregation shall declare his alms.

verses.plain: If thou sit at a bountiful table, be not greedy upon it, and say not, There is much meat on it.

tokens.t: If thou sit at a bountiful table, be not greedy upon it, and say not, There is much meat on it.

verses.plain: Remember that a wicked eye is an evil thing: and what is created more wicked than an eye? therefore it weepeth upon every occasion.

tokens.t: Remember that a wicked eye is an evil thing: and what is created more wicked than an eye? therefore it weepeth upon every occasion.

verses.plain: Stretch not thine hand whithersoever it looketh, and thrust it not with him into the dish.

tokens.t: Stretch not thine hand whithersoever it looketh, and thrust it not with him into the dish.

verses.plain: Judge not thy neighbour by thyself: and be discreet in every point.

tokens.t: Judge not thy neighbour by thyself: and be discreet in every point.

verses.plain: Eat as it becometh a man, those things which are set before thee; and devour not, lest thou be hated.

tokens.t: Eat as it becometh a man, those things which are set before thee; and devour not, lest thou be hated.

verses.plain: Leave off first for manners’ sake; and be not unsatiable, lest thou offend.

tokens.t: Leave off first for manners’ sake; and be not unsatiable, lest thou offend.

verses.plain: When thou sittest among many, reach not thine hand out first of all.

tokens.t: When thou sittest among many, reach not thine hand out first of all.

verses.plain: A very little is sufficient for a man well nurtured, and he fetcheth not his wind short upon his bed.

tokens.t: A very little is sufficient for a man well nurtured, and he fetcheth not his wind short upon his bed.

verses.plain: Sound sleep cometh of moderate eating: he riseth early, and his wits are with him: but the pain of watching, and choler, and pangs of the belly, are with an unsatiable man.

tokens.t: Sound sleep cometh of moderate eating: he riseth early, and his wits are with him: but the pain of watching, and choler, and pangs of the belly, are with an unsatiable man.

verses.plain: And if thou hast been forced to eat, arise, go forth, vomit, and thou shalt have rest.

tokens.t: And if thou hast been forced to eat, arise, go forth, vomit, and thou shalt have rest.

verses.plain: My son, hear me, and despise me not, and at the last thou shalt find as I told thee: in all thy works be quick, so shall there no sickness come unto thee.

tokens.t: My son, hear me, and despise me not, and at the last thou shalt find as I told thee: in all thy works be quick, so shall there no sickness come unto thee.

verses.plain: Whoso is liberal of his meat, men shall speak well of him; and the report of his good housekeeping will be believed.

tokens.t: Whoso is liberal of his meat, men shall speak well of him; and the report of his good housekeeping will be believed.

verses.plain: But against him that is a niggard of his meat the whole city shall murmur; and the testimonies of his niggardness shall not be doubted of.

tokens.t: But against him that is a niggard of his meat the whole city shall murmur; and the testimonies of his niggardness shall not be doubted of.

verses.plain: Shew not thy valiantness in wine; for wine hath destroyed many.

tokens.t: Shew not thy valiantness in wine; for wine hath destroyed many.

verses.plain: The furnace proveth the edge by dipping: so doth wine the hearts of the proud by drunkeness.

tokens.t: The furnace proveth the edge by dipping: so doth wine the hearts of the proud by drunkeness.

verses.plain: Wine is as good as life to a man, if it be drunk moderately: what life is then to a man that is without wine? for it was made to make men glad.

tokens.t: Wine is as good as life to a man, if it be drunk moderately: what life is then to a man that is without wine? for it was made to make men glad.

verses.plain: Wine measurably drunk and in season bringeth gladness of the heart, and cheerfulness of the mind:

tokens.t: Wine measurably drunk and in season bringeth gladness of the heart, and cheerfulness of the mind:

verses.plain: But wine drunken with excess maketh bitterness of the mind, with brawling and quarrelling.

tokens.t: But wine drunken with excess maketh bitterness of the mind, with brawling and quarrelling.

verses.plain: Drunkenness increaseth the rage of a fool till he offend: it diminisheth strength, and maketh wounds.

tokens.t: Drunkenness increaseth the rage of a fool till he offend: it diminisheth strength, and maketh wounds.

verses.plain: Rebuke not thy neighbour at the wine, and despise him not in his mirth: give him no despiteful words, and press not upon him with urging him to drink.
